message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and family history suggest a muscular dystrophy, and the genetic study revealing a significant deletion in the gene that codes for dystrophin is highly indicative of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Becker muscular dystrophy also involves dystrophin, but usually has a later onset and milder symptoms. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy have different genetic mutations and clinical presentations.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of weakness and delayed motor skills, along with a notable deletion in the gene for dystrophin, suggests Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which is the most common type of muscular dystrophy in children. Becker muscular dystrophy is also caused by a dystrophin gene mutation but is less severe and has a later onset than Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy are both different types of muscular dystrophy with distinct clinical features and genetic causes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of weakness, delayed walking, and trouble with motor skills suggest muscular dystrophy. The significant deletion in the gene that codes for dystrophin is a characteristic of Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which typically presents in early childhood and affects boys more often than girls. Becker muscular dystrophy is a milder form of muscular dystrophy that presents later in childhood or early adulthood. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy also present with weakness, but have different genetic mutations and clinical features.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of delayed walking, difficulty with gross motor skills, and family history of similar symptoms suggest that the boy has a muscular dystrophy. The significant deletion in the gene that codes for dystrophin points towards Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which is the most common type of muscular dystrophy in children.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the genetic study suggest that the boy has Duchenne muscular dystrophy, an X-linked recessive disorder that affects primarily males. The deletion in the gene that codes for dystrophin is the most frequent genetic cause of this disease. The onset of symptoms is typically delayed until a child begins walking, which is consistent with the mother's report. The boy's weakness and difficulty walking are also common early symptoms of Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, age of onset, and genetic study results suggest that the most likely diagnosis is Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Becker muscular dystrophy usually has later onset and a milder course. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy affects the upper legs and is less severe than Duchenne. Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy typically presents later in life with cardiac and joint symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Given the age, delay in walking, trouble with motor skills, and family history, the most likely diagnosis is Duchenne muscular dystrophy. The genetic study result of a significant deletion in the gene that codes for dystrophin is also consistent with this diagnosis. Becker muscular dystrophy is also caused by a mutation in the dystrophin gene but usually has a less severe course. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy have different genetic mutations and present with different clinical features.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Duchenne muscular dystrophy is the most likely diagnosis given the significant deletion of the dystrophin gene, delayed walking, trouble with gross motor skills, and weakness. Becker muscular dystrophy is also caused by mutations in the dystrophin gene but presents later in life and progresses more slowly. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy have different genetic causes and clinical presentations.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, delayed motor skills, and genetic study indicate Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which is caused by a deletion in the gene that codes for dystrophin. Becker muscular dystrophy is also caused by a dystrophin gene mutation, but it is not usually diagnosed until later in childhood or adolescence. Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy have different genetic mutations and clinical presentations.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, delayed walking, and trouble with gross and fine motor skills, along with the genetic study revealing a significant deletion in the dystrophin gene, suggest the most likely diagnosis is Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Becker muscular dystrophy also involves a dystrophin gene mutation but has a later onset and milder symptoms. Limb-girdle and Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophies have different genetic mutations and different patterns of muscle weakness.
